page.title: 05WOODLAND
page.content: This part of the country looks well-wooded, but the total area of woodland is small. Shelter Belts of mixed woodland, deciduous trees along the road sides and groups of trees round houses help to create this impression. Only to the east on the fringes of Tentsmuir forest are the areas of trees fairly extensive. Plantations of Scots pine, spruce and larch stretch northwards from the stones of the Eden eastuary over to the poor sandy soils of the area. Here woodland is on the increase; the Forestry Commission owns it and is working it commercially. Yew trees, trimmed into wierd shapes are a feature of the gardens of Earlshall where grounds contain many mature specimin trees.
